H0.text: A layer of fat is what mammals have under the skin to help insulate the body.

H1.text: Bone is what mammals have under the skin to help insulate the body.

H2.text: Nerve cells are what mammals have under the skin to help insulate the body.

H3.text: Cartilage is what mammals have under the skin to help insulate the body.

A4.text: In the integumentary system, which includes the skin, it accumulates in the deepest level, the subcutaneous layer, providing insulation from heat and cold.

A5.text: Adipose tissue is located beneath the skin (subcutaneous fat)... its main role is to store energy in the form of lipids, although it also cushions and insulates the body.
